Sequence Information.Target Organism: [Ref.28073163] Gram-positive bacteria:Bacillus megaterium ATCC 14581 (IC50 = 237 μM, MIC > 20 μM), Staphylococcus aureus ATCC 6538 (IC50 = 188 μM, MIC > 20 μM), Enterococcus faecalis ATCC 29212 (IC50 = 134 μM, MIC > 20 μM);Gram-negative bacteria:Escherichia coli ATCC 700926 (IC50 = 805 μM, MIC > 20 μM);Fungi:Candida albicans 002 ATCC 64385 (IC50 = 20 μM, MIC > 20 μM), C. albicans 004 ATCC MYA-2876 (IC50 = 20 μM, MIC > 20 μM).
Sequence Information.Hemolytic Activity: [Ref.28073163] HC50 = 1810 μM against human red blood cells. Note:HC50 is the half-maximal hemolytic concentration.
Sequence Information.Cytotoxicity: No cytotoxicity information found in the reference(s) presented
Sequence Information.Structure Description: LP1 appears to adopt a random-coli conformation.
Sequence Information.Function: Potential antifungal activity against Candida albicans.

Literature.Title: Hydrocarbon-stapled lipopeptides exhibit selective antimicrobial activity
Literature.Author: Zachary B Jenner, Christopher M Crittenden, Martín Gonzalez, Jennifer S Brodbelt, Kerry A Bruns
